name: Vegan Pizza Waffles
description: Vegan Pizza Waffles stuffed with bell peppers, mushrooms and mozzarella are a must-try for all pizza lovers and everyone craving pizza for breakfast! Perfectly cheesy yet light and crispy and with pizza sauce and favorite pizza toppings. No nuts! Makes 10-11 mini waffles and 4-5 regular size waffles

video.name: Easy Vegan PIZZA Waffles! Crispy savory cheesy! Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Take your waffles game to the next level! I give you Pizza Waffles!! HELLO, crispy savory vegan waffles stuffed with Italian pizza topping classics like mushrooms, bell peppers and vegan mozzarella cheese. They are amazing straight from the waffle iron but I can also see them getting dipped into warm marinara.

Look at these crispy golden edges! everything you love in a pizza… The toppings, the cheese, and the crispy part of the dough – all compressed into one neat little package!

Recipe link: https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-pizza-waffles/

#VeganRecipe #PizzaWaffles #VeganWaffles #SavoryWaffles #Waffles #VeganPizza #VeganBreakfast #EasyVeganLunch #VeganMeal

recipeIngredient: 1 Tbsp semolina flour or rice flour (or use more all purpose )
optional add ins: 1/2 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp pepper flakes
½ cup thinly sliced red or green bell pepper (or a mix of both)
½ cup or more  thinly sliced mushrooms
½ cup other thinly sliced vegetables of your choice (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Make the pizza batter first - add all of the dry ingredients to a bowl and mix well. Add in the extra virgin olive oil and warm water, mix until the mixture is like a pancake batter. Let this mixture sit for 20-25 minutes until it gets bubbly. (You can add in some dried oregano, garlic powder for flavor or swirl in a bit of pizza sauce jn the batter itself for variation)

recipeInstructions.name: Meanwhile you can chop up the vegetables and gather other additions

recipeInstructions.text: To make the waffles, heat your waffle iron and add a few drops of oil. Add a spoonful of the pizza batter and spread it around - you want a thin layer. Add a small spoonful of the pizza sauce at every corner, not too much
recipeInstructions.name: To make the waffles, heat your waffle iron and add a few drops of oil. Add a spoonful of the pizza batter and spread it around - you want a thin layer. Add a small spoonful of the pizza sauce at every corner, not too much

recipeInstructions.text: Top this with your sliced mushrooms, peppers, and shredded mozzarella. Add another layer of the pizza batter on top, no need to cover the entire surface. Top with optional minced garlic and drizzle of oil and close waffle iron
recipeInstructions.name: Top this with your sliced mushrooms, peppers, and shredded mozzarella. Add another layer of the pizza batter on top, no need to cover the entire surface. Top with optional minced garlic and drizzle of oil and close waffle iron

recipeInstructions.text: Let the waffle cook until it’s golden brown on both sides, flip waffle if it’s not browning evenly, cook for a few more minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Let the waffle cook until it’s golden brown on both sides, flip waffle if it’s not browning evenly, cook for a few more minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Repeat for all of the waffles, transfer prepared waffles onto a rack so they don’t get soggy. Serve immediately, these are best when served warm and crispyTo reheat, you can reheat for 5-10 mins in the oven at 400 deg F which will also help keep them crispy
